turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: "True love." He said, "true love," Max. My God --

turns.speaker: MIRACLE MAX
turns.text: Don't say another word, Valerie.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: He's afraid. Ever since Prince Humperdinck fired him, his confidence is shattered.

turns.speaker: MIRACLE MAX
turns.text: Why'd you say that name -- you promised me that you would never say that name --

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: What, Humperdinck? Humperdinck. Humperdinck. Ooo-ooo, Humperdinck

turns.speaker: MIRACLE MAX
turns.text: I'm not listening.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: A life expiring and you don't have the decency to say why you won't help --

turns.speaker: MIRACLE MAX
turns.text: Nobody's hearing nothing!

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Humperdinck. Humperdinck! Humperdinck!

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: The chocolate coating makes it go down easier. But you have to wait fifteen minutes for full potency. And you shouldn't go swimming after, for at least, what?

turns.speaker: MIRACLE MAX
turns.text: An hour.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Yeah, an hour.

turns.speaker: MIRACLE MAX
turns.text: A good hour. Yeah.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Bye-bye, boys.

turns.speaker: MIRACLE MAX
turns.text: Have fun storming the castle.

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Think it'll work?

turns.speaker: MIRACLE MAX
turns.text: It would take a miracle. Bye!

turns.speaker: VALERIE
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: You feeling any better?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: A little bit.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Guess what.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Your grandfather's here.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Mom, can't you tell him that I'm sick?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: You are sick, that's why he's here.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: He'll pinch my cheek. I hate that.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Maybe he won't.

turns.speaker: DE BRIS
turns.text: How would you like to go back to teasing hair, big mouth?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Roger, do you mind if we talk a little business?

turns.speaker: DE BRIS
turns.text: Please, please, that's what we're here for.  Be careful, that hurt.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: I think this would be a marvelous opportunity for you, Roger.  Up to now, you've always been associated with musicals, and...

turns.speaker: DE BRIS
turns.text: Yes.  Dopey show-girls in gooey gowns.  Two-three-kick-turn!  Turn- turn-kick-turn!  It's enough to make you throw up!  At last a chance to do straight drama!  To deal with conflict, with inner truth.  Roger De Bris presents history.  Of course, I think we should add a little music.  That whole third act has got to go. They're losing the war.  It's too depressing.  We'll have to put something in there.  Aaahghhh!  I see it!  A line of beautiful girls, dressed as Storm Troopers, black patent leather boots, all marching together... Two-three-kick-turn!  Turn-turn- kick-turn!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: That's genius.  That's genius. Roger, I think I speak for Mr. Bloom and myself when I say that you're the only man in the world who can do justice to SPRINGTIME FOR HITLER.

turns.speaker: DE BRIS
turns.text: Wait a minute.  This is a very big decision.  It might effect the course of my entire life.  I'll have to think about it.  I'll do it.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Congratulations.

turns.speaker: DE BRIS
turns.text: Get on the phone.  Send out a casting call.  Call every agent in town.  I want to see everybody. Everybody.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Wait!  This is Boomerang.  This is Boomerang.

turns.speaker: DE BRIS
turns.text: What are you saying?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Let's hear him.  What have we got to lose?  What's your name?

turns.speaker: BLOOM AND DRUNK
turns.text: "By the light, by the light,

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: "Of the silvery moon,

turns.speaker: BLOOM AND DRUNK
turns.text: "Of the silvery mooooon,

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: "I want to croon,

turns.speaker: BLOOM AND DRUNK
turns.text: "He wants to croon, he wants to croon,

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: "To my honey I'll croon,

turns.speaker: BLOOM AND DRUNK
turns.text: "He's gonna croon love's tune,

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: "Honeymoon,

turns.speaker: BLOOM AND DRUNK
turns.text: "Honeymoon, honeymoon,

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: "Keep a shining in...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Enough.  It's better.  Please, Lambchop, it's better.  Stop. You're hurting it again.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: How do you do.  I mean ... Excuse me ... I mean ...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You mean ooops, don't you?  Say ooops and get out.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I'll wait in the hall ...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Oooooooops!

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Ooooooops.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Uh ... uh ... ooooooops?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Who are you?  What do you want? Why are you loitering in my hallway? Speak, dummy, speak!  Why don't you speak?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Scared.  Can't talk.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: All right.  Get a hold of yourself. Take a deep breath, let it out slowly and tell me who you are.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I'm Leo Bloom, I'm an accountant, I'm from Whitehall and Marks, I was sent here to do your books and I'm terribly sorry I caught you with the old lady.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Then account for yourself!  Do you believe in God?  Do you believe in gold?  Why are you looking up old lady's dresses?  Bit of a pervert, eh?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: But sir, I'm not condem ...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Shut up.  I'm having a rhetorical conversation.  How humiliating.  Max Bialystock. Max Bialystock.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You have exactly ten seconds to change that disgusting look of pity into one of enormous respect.  One ... Two ...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Do the books!  Do the books!

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Yes, sir.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Window's so filthy, can't tell if it's day or night out there.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Look at that.  A white Rolls Royce. That's it baby, when you got it, flaunt it.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Koff, koff ... ahem, ahem ... harrumph ...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: I assume you are making those cartoon noises to attract my attention.  Am I correct in my assumption, you fish-faced enemy of the people?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: I have hurt your feelings.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Good, what is it?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Sir, may I speak to you for a minute?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Go!  You have fifty-eight seconds.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Well, sir, it seems ...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You have forty-eight seconds left. Hurry.  Hurry.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: In looking at your books, I've discovered that ...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Twenty-eight seconds, hurry, hurry, you're using up your time.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What is that?  A handkerchief?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: It's nothing ... nothing.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Here, don't panic.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I'm sorry ... I don't like people touching my blue blanket.  It's not important.  It's a minor compulsion. I can deal with it if I want to. It's just that I've had it ever since I was a baby and ... and ... I find it very comforting.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: They come here.  They all come here. How do they find me?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Mr. Bialystock ...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Yes, Prince Mishkin, what can we do for you?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: This is hardly a time for levity. I've discovered a serious error here in the accounts of your last play.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Where?  What?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: According to the backer's list you raised $60,000.  But the show you produced only cost fifty-eight thousand.  There's two thousand dollars unaccounted for.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: I went to a Turkish bath, who cares? The show was a flop.  What difference does it make?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: It makes a great deal of difference. That's fraud.  If they found out, you could go to prison.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Why should they find out?  It's only two thousand dollars,  Bloom, do me a favor, move a few decimal points around.  You can do it. You're an accountant.  The word 'count' is part of your title.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: But that's cheating!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: It's not cheating ... It's charity. Bloom, look at me ... look at me! I'm drowning.  Other men sail through life.  Bialystock has struck a reef.  Bloom, I'm going under.  I am being sunk by a society that demands success, when all I can offer is failure.  Bloom, I'm reaching out to you.  Don't send me to jail.  Help!  Help!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Help!

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: All right.  I'll do it.  I'll do it.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Thank you, Bloom.  I knew I could con you.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Oh, it's all right ... wha?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Nothing.  Nothing.  Do it.  Do it.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Now let's see, two thousand dollars. That isn't much.  I'm sure I can hide it somewhere.  After all, the department of internal revenue isn't interested in a show that flopped.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Yes.  Right.  Good thinking.  You figure it out.  I'm tired.  I'm gonna take a little nap.  Wake me if there's a fire.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Now let's see, if we add these figures, we get ...

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Yes, what?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What you were saying.  Keep talking.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: What was I saying?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You were saying that under the right circumstances, a producer could make more money with a flop than he could with a hit.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Yes, it's quite possible.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You keep saying that, but you don't tell me how.  How could a producer make more money with a flop than with a hit?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Assume away!

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Well, it's very easy.  You simply raise more money than you really need.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: You've done it yourself, only you did it on a very small scale.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What did I do?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: You raised two thousand more than you needed to produce your last play.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: So what?  What did it get me?  I'm wearing a cardboard belt.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Ahhhhhh!  But that's where you made your error.  You didn't go all the way.  You see, if you were really a bold criminal, you could have raised a million.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: But the play only cost $60,000 to produce.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Exactly.  And how long did it run?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: One night.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: See?  You could have raised a million dollars, put on a sixty thousand dollar flop and kept the rest.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: But what if the play was a hit?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Oh, you'd go to jail.  If the play were a hit, you'd have to pay off the backers, and with so many backers there could never be enough profits to go around, get it?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Aha, aha, aha, aha, aha, aha!!  So, in order for the scheme to work, we'd have to find a sure fire flop.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: What scheme?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What scheme?  Your scheme, you bloody little genius.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Oh, no.  No.  No.  I meant no scheme.  I merely posed a little, academic accounting theory.  It's just a thought.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Bloom, worlds are turned on such thoughts!

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Mr. Bialystock.  No.  Wait.  Please. You're holding me too tight.  I'm an honest man.  You don't understand.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: No, Bloom, you don't understand. This is fate, this is destiny. There's no avoiding it.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Mr. Bialystock, not more than five minutes ago, against my better judgment, I doctored your books. That, sir, is the ultimate extent of my criminal life.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Oh, I fell on my keys.  I've got to get out of here.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You miserable, cowardly, wretched little caterpillar.  Don't you ever want to become a butterfly?  Don't you want to spread your wings and flap your way to glory?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: You're going to jump on me.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: You're going to jump on me.  I know you're going to jump on me -- like Nero jumped on Poppea.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What???

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Poppea.  She was his wife.  And she was unfaithful to him.  So he got mad and he jumped on her.  Up and down, up and down, until he squashed her like a bug.  Please don't jump on me.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: I'm not going to jump on you!

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Aaaaaaaaaa!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Will you get a hold on yourself.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Don't touch me!  Don't touch me!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What are you afraid of?  I'm not going to hurt you!  What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I'm hysterical.  I'm having hysterics.  I'm hysterical.  I can't stop.  When I get like this, I can't stop.  I'm hysterical.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What can I do?  What can I do? You're getting me hysterical.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Go away from me.  You frighten me.  Sit over there.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Okay.  I'm way over here.  Is that better?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: It's a little better, but you still look angry.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: How's this?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Good.  Good.  That's nice.  That's very nice.  I think I'm coming out of it now.  Yes.  Yes.  I'm definitely coming out of it.  Thank you for smiling.  It helped a great deal.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Well, you know what they say, "Smile and the world smiles with you."  Heh, heh.  The man should be in a straight jacket.  Feeling better?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Much, thank you.  But I am a little lightheaded.  Maybe I should eat something.  Hysterics have a way of severely depleting one's blood sugar, you know.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: They certainly do.  They certainly do.  Come, let me take you to lunch.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: That's very kind of you, Mr. Bialystock, but I ...

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I got it, Mr. Bialystock.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Thank you, Leo.  And call me Max. You know, I don't let everybody call me Max.  It's only people I really like.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Okay ... Max!  And you can call me Leo.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: I already have.  Come on.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Where would you like to eat?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Well, Max, I don't know, Max.  What do you think, Max?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Let me see ... it's such a beautiful day.  Why waste it indoors.  I've got it!  Let's go to Coney Island! We'll lunch at the sea shore.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Coney Island??

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What's the matter, Leo?  Don't you like Coney Island?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I ... I love it.  I haven't been there since I was a kid.  But it's nearly two o'clock.  I really should be getting back to Whitehall and Marks.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Nonsense!  As far as Whitehall and Marks are concerned, you're working with Bialystock, right?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Then stick with Bialystock!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What kind now, Leo?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I don't know.  Let's see.  We've had chocolate, vanilla, banana - let's go green.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Two pistachios, my good man.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Everybody's a big shot.  Well, Leo, are you having a good time?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I don't know.  I think so.  I feel very strange.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Maybe you're happy.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Yes.  That's it.  Happy.  Well, whatta ya think of that.  Happy.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You think you're not in prison now? Living in a grey little room. Going to a grey little job.  Leading a grey little life.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: You're right.  You're absolutely right.  I'm a nothing.  I spend my life counting other people's money -- people I'm smarter than, better than.  Where's my share? Where's Leo Bloom's share?  I want, I want, I want, I want everything I've ever seen in the movies!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You bet your boots, Leo.  It's Bialystock and Bloom -- on the rise. Upward and onward.  Say, you'll join me.  Nothing can stop us.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I'll do it!  By God, I'll do it!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: This is where we belong, Leo.  On top of the world.  Top of the world!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You can't feel it when it's in your hand, when it's in your pocket.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Max, what is it?  What are you doing?  What's happening?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: I'll tell you what's happening. We've struck gold.  Not fool's gold, but real gold.  The mother lode.  The mother lode.  The mother of them all.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: You found a flop!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: A flop, ha!  That's putting it mildly.  A disaster!  A catastrophe! An outrage!  A guaranteed-to-close- in-one-night beauty!

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: It won't run a week!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Run a week?  Are you kidding?  This play has got to close in the first act.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Who wrote it?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Max, I don't want to take any Siegfried Oath.  I don't know what it is, but I don't want to take it. We might end up in the German Army.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Shut up, you idiot.  He's a harmless nut.  Play along with him.  It's almost in the bag.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: There it is... in red and white! "Springtime For Hitler," signed, sealed and delivered.  What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Look, I'm just not wearing this arm band.  I don't care how big the deal is.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Okay, take it off, take it off.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Mrs. Eleanor Biddlecombe.  She also owns 50% of the profits.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Mrs. Virginia Resnick.  She also owns 50% of the profits.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Mrs. Alma Wentworth.  She owns 100% of the profits.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Leo, what if this play is a hit?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Then the Department of Justice owns 100% of Bialystock and Bloom.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: OI.  I'm depressed.  Leo, do me a favor.  Open the safe.  I want to see the money.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: I'm going to buy a toy.  I worked very, very hard and I think I deserve a toy.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: How do you do.  Have you gone mad?  A receptionist that can't speak English.  What will people say?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: They'll say, "Oooh, wah, wah, wah, ooh, ooh."

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: What is she gonna do here?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: I'll show you.  Ulla, go to work.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Max, as I was saying, maybe we should go easy on the spending.  I mean these offices and everything.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Why?  Take it when you can get it! Flaunt it, baby, flaunt it!

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: But if something should... God forbid... go wrong, at least we could give them some of their money back.  It would look better in court.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Stop talking like that, you white mouse!  Nothing's going to go wrong. As a matter of fact, today I have taken steps to insure total disaster. At two o'clock we have an appointment with none other than Roger De Bris.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Roger De Bris.  Roger De Bris.  Oh yes, the director.  Is he good... I mean bad?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Roger De Bris is the worst director that ever lived.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Do you think he'll take the job?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Only if we ask him.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Well, it's... uh... it's nice and long... I mean, it's... uh... uh... where do you keep your wallet?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: It's gorgeous.  Absolutely gorgeous. You couldn't have picked a better color.  It brings out your eyes. Let's face it, Roger, that dress is you.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: So much for Nutsy Fagin.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Here comes the Times Drama Critic.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Watch closely, as Bialystock drives the last nail into the coffin.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: To failure!

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: To failure!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Maybe it's not true!

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: No way out.  No way out.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Bloom, Bloom, maybe it's not true.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: No way out.  No way out.  What?  Who?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Why don't we go over to the theatre and see what's really happening? After all, we've only heard from a small portion of the audience. Let's hear what the majority thinks.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: The majority.  The majority.  Yes. Let's hear from the majority.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What are you doing with those books? Where are you going?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I'm turning myself in.  It's the only way.  I'm going to cooperate with the authorities.  They'll reduce my sentence and then there's time off for good behavior.  And maybe I'll get a job in the prison library.  So long.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: I never should have listened to you.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Ohhhhhhhhh, how I hate you.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Double.  Double.  Double.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Here.  Buy bullets.  Kill.  Kill them all!

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: What???

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: They are?  Have you ever eaten with one?  Liebkind, go!  Kill!

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Liebkind, no!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What are you doing?  We're trapped. It's either the show or us.  There's no way out.  What can we do, blow up the theatre?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Max, I...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Well, I... Well, it's just that... I'm sorry I called you fat, fat, fat.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Ahhhhhh.  Leo, Leo, Leo.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Don't help me.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: He's a liar and a cheat and a scoundrel.  He's taken money from little old ladies.  He's talked people into doing things they never would have dreamed of.  Especially me.  But who has he really hurt?

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: I vas never a member of the Nazi party.  I am not responsible.  I only followed orders.  Who are you?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Mr. Liebkind, wait.  You don't understand.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Vhy do you persecute me?  My papers are in order.  I love my country.  "Oh, beautiful for spacious skies, For amber vaves of grain."

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Mr. Liebkind, wait ...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: "I'm a Yankee Doodle Dandy ...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Mr. Liebkind, relax, relax, we're not from the government.  We came here to talk to you about your play.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: My play?  You mean, "Springtime For ... " you know who?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Vat about it?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: We loved it.  We thought it was a masterpiece.  That's why we're here. We want to produce it on Broadway.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: You're not, as you Americans say, dragging my leg, are you?

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: I vas vit him a great deal, you know.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: With whom?

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Vit the Fuhrer, of course.  He liked me.  Out of all the household staff at Berchtesgarten, I vas his favorite.  I vas the only one allowed into his chambers at bedtime.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: No kidding?

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Oh, sure.  I used to take him his hot milk and his opium.  Achhh, those were the days.  Vat good times ve had.  Dinner parties vit lovely ladies and gentlemen, singing und dancing.  You know, not many people knew about it, but the Fuhrer vas a terrific dancer.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Really, I never dreamed ...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: That's because you were taken in by that verdampter Allied propaganda. Such filthy lies.  But nobody said a bad vord about Winston Churchill, did they?  Oh no, Vin Vit Vinnie!  Churchill, vit his cigars and his brandy and his rotten paintings. Couldn't even say Nazi.  He would say Narzis, Narzis.  Ve vere not Narzies, ve vere Nazis.  But let me tell this, and you're getting it straight from the horse, Hitler vas better looking than Churchill, he vas a better dresser than Churchill, had more hair, told funnier jokes, and could dance the pants off Churchill!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: That's exactly why we want to do this play.  To show the world the true Hitler, the Hitler you knew, the Hitler you loved, the Hitler with a song in his heart.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Wait.  No.  How do I know I can trust you?  How do I know you vill present this play in the manner and spirit in vhich it vas conceived?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: We swear it!

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Not good enough... Vould you be villing to take the Siegfried oath?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Yes.  We would!

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Good.  I will make the preparations.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You think out of all those Hitlers you could find just one...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: It was the same thing in Germany. We looked for years before we found the right Hitler.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Vaaaat???

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Franz, don't you see, Hitler was a man of his time.  This is a man of his time.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: But he has long hair!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Don't look at the outside, look at the inside.  It's the inner Hitler we're after.  The young beautiful Hitler, who danced his way to glory.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: I don't know.  I don't know.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Franz, trust me.  I promise I won't let you down.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: All right, but remember, if you damage the Fuhrer's reputation, I kill you.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Not.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Cowards, miserable cringing cowards. Clinging to life like baby butterflies.  Vatch, vatch and remember.  Franz Liebkind vill show you how to die like a man!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Five o'clock.  Killed a whole day playing hide-and-seek with a crazy Kraut.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: I'm not crazy.  I'm inept.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Vhere?  Vhere?... oh...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You crazy lunatic!  What are you shooting at us for?  Why don't you use this  where it will do us some good?  Why don't you shoot the actors?  Liebkind, have I ever steered you wrong?

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Always.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Never mind.  Listen.  Every night people are laughing at your beloved Fuhrer.  Why?

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: It's that LSD und his verdampter babies!...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Now ve take the two fuse leads, attach them to the terminals of the conductor and ve're in business.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You mean out of business.  Heh, heh.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Plus to minus.  Negative to positive. Male to...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Come on.  Let's get going.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Qviet.  Qviet  This is very important.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Here.  You see.  This is the slow fuse.  It is much wider.  It has more resistance, more density. Therefore, it burns slower.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: You mean you had the slow fuse in your pocket all the time and you forgot to put it on?

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Yes.  Amazing isn't it?

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Vhy do you always call me kraut? Kraut is cabbage!  Do ve call you hot dogs?  Ve call you Yanks not franks!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: All right.  Finish the job.  Let's get outta here.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Do it!  Do it!

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: I can't.  I can't do it.  It's a demon.  It's a gargoyle, it's a monster... but it's still my child.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Do you need us?

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Of course I need you.  It's dark in there.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Yes.  She's an adult, educational toy made in Sweden for children over fifty.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Stop looking at me like that. She's not an indulgence.  She happens to be our new receptionist. She goes with our new surroundings.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Ulla, I'd like you to meet my partner and associate, Mr. Leo Bloom.

turns.speaker: ULLA
turns.text: Got dag pa dig.

turns.speaker: ULLA
turns.text: Bialystock and Blum.  Bialystock and Blum.  Bialystock and Blum. Got dag pa dig.  Bialystock and Blum.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Hey, Blum, have a cigar.

turns.speaker: ULLA
turns.text: Min Bialystock.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Nice girl.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Come on.  We'd better hurry.  We're late.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Call chauffeur.  Get car.

turns.speaker: ULLA
turns.text: Good.  Good.  We go Motel.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: No.  We go.

turns.speaker: ULLA
turns.text: You, Blum go Motel.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: No.  No Motel.  Get car.  Get car.

turns.speaker: ULLA
turns.text: Get car.  Get car.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Very nice girl.

turns.speaker: ULLA
turns.text: We make love?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: No!  No!  We don't make love.  Go to work.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Don't forget the checkee.  Can't produce playees without checkees.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: You can count on me-o, you dirty young man.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: Finder's keepers.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Here I come, ready or not.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: Feeling better?

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: Good.  Let's fool around.  Now, I'll be the innocent little milk maid and you'll be the naughty stable boy.  Oh, this milk is so heavy.  I'll never reach the house.  Help.  Will someone help me?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Wait.  Wait.  We can't play today. I have too many appointments.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: We can't play today?

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Thursday.  Thursday.  We'll play Thursday.  We'll play the Contessa and the chauffeur.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: Oh, the best one.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Until Thursday, then, Contessa Mio.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: Oh, Bialy, please, just a little. Just a little.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: All right.  All right.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: So, the Count hired you this morning, Rudolfo ... Watch the road ... Watch the road.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: I can't take my eyes off you.  How can I drive when you drive me mad. Mad.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: Rudolfo, you dirty pig!  Pull over.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Good.  That's enough.  We'll do the rest on Thursday.  That's a good girl.  It's always such fun to see you.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Until Thursday, then, you bawdy wench.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: Oooh.  I love it.  Hold me, touch me.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Thursday.  I'll see you Thursday.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: And we'll finish playing the Contessa and Rudolfo.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Good.  Yes.  Thursday.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: And after that we'll play the Abduction and cruel rape of Lucretia ... And I'll play Lucretia.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Like clockwork.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: I shall count the minutes.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Goodbye, my angel ... My angel!  Hey, touch me ... wait!  Hey, uh ... Lucretia, Lucretia!

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: Of course, the check, I had it with me all the time.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: I don't know what's happening to me. I must be getting old.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: Is it all right?  I made it out to cash.  You didn't tell me the name of the play.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Oh, it's fine.  Fine.  Good.  Good. Bye.  Bye.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: Til Thursday, my Darling, I shall count the minutes.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: Ta.  Ta.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Ta.  Ta.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK
turns.text: Smasheroo.  Smasheroo.

turns.speaker: LITTLE OLD LADY
turns.text: Oh, I'd better hurry back.  I don't want to miss one minute of it.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK AND BLOOM
turns.text: I solemnly swear...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: By the sacred memory...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK AND BLOOM
turns.text: By the sacred memory...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Of Siegfried...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK AND BLOOM
turns.text: Of Siegfried...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Wagner...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK AND BLOOM
turns.text: Wagner...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Nietzche...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK AND BLOOM
turns.text: Nietzche...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Bismark...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK AND BLOOM
turns.text: Bismark...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Hindenburg...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK AND BLOOM
turns.text: Hindenburg...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: The Graf Spee...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK AND BLOOM
turns.text: The Graf Spee...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: The Blue Max...

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK AND BLOOM
turns.text: The Blue Max...

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: And last, but not least, Adolph... you know who.

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK AND BLOOM
turns.text: And last, but not least, Adolph... you know who.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Heil you know who!

turns.speaker: BIALYSTOCK AND BLOOM
turns.text: Heil you know who!

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Good.  Good.  Now ve sign the contract.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: No, not at all sir, we're quite serious.  We want to produce your play.  I have the contracts right here.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Oh joy of joys!  Oh, dream of dreams!  I can't believe it.  Birds, birds, do you hear?  Otto, Bertz, Heintz, Hans, Wolfgang, do you hear?  Ve are going to clear the Fuhrer's name.  Fly, fly, spread the words.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: "Deutchland, Deutchland, uber alles, Uber alles in der velt."

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: "Deutchland, Deutchland ... "

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Mr. Liebkind, Mr. Liebkind.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Vat?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: People can hear you.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: OH.  "I'm a Yankee Doodle Dandy, Yankee Doodle is my ... " Listen, this is not place to talk.  Come!

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Yes.  The actors.  I must destroy the actors.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Stop!  Stop!  This is insanity.

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Where are you going vit the light?

turns.speaker: BLOOM
turns.text: I need it.  How'm I gonna find the fuse?

turns.speaker: LIEBKIND
turns.text: Oh, ve come vit you.  All for one and all in the light.

turns.speaker: LSD
turns.text: Lorenzo Saint DuBois.  But everybody calls me LSD.

turns.speaker: DE BRIS
turns.text: What have you done, LSD?

turns.speaker: LSD
turns.text: Six months, I'm out on probation, but it's cool now, baby.

turns.speaker: DE BRIS
turns.text: I mean in show business.

turns.speaker: LSD
turns.text: Oh, in show business.  Well, let's put it this way, my next job will be my debut.

turns.speaker: DE BRIS
turns.text: What do you do best?

turns.speaker: LSD
turns.text: Hey, man, I can't do that here, that's what they put me away for.

turns.speaker: DE BRIS
turns.text: Oh, sing.  Sing!

turns.speaker: LSD
turns.text: Hey, baby, that's where they put me, Sing-Sing.  How'd you know that, you been up?

turns.speaker: DE BRIS
turns.text: Sing a song!  Just sing a song!

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: We are falling back on all fronts. Our soldiers are retreating.

turns.speaker: LSD
turns.text: No good, baby, no good.  You heard my orders.  Nobody retreats. Attack!  Attack!

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: Who can we attack?  They're all too big.

turns.speaker: LSD
turns.text: Hey, man, let's stomp Switzerland!

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: We can't... we keep our money there!

turns.speaker: LSD
turns.text: Where's Goebbels?  Where's my little Joe?

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: Send for Goebbels.

turns.speaker: LSD
turns.text: He's the only cat left that still grooves me.

turns.speaker: GOEBBELS
turns.text: Heil, baby!  I just finished the morning propaganda broadcasts.

turns.speaker: LSD
turns.text: What did you tell the people?

turns.speaker: GOEBBELS
turns.text: I told them we invaded England.

turns.speaker: LSD
turns.text: Hey, baby, that's good!  How'd we come out?

turns.speaker: GOEBBELS
turns.text: We won.

turns.speaker: LSD
turns.text: Groovy!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I always forget to put the sign on, but we do have vacancy.  Twelve in fact. Twelve cabins, twelve vacancies.

turns.speaker: ARBOGAST
turns.text: In the past two days I've been to so many motels, my eyes are bleary with neon. This is the first one that looked like it was hiding from the world at large.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I don't really forget the sign, it just doesn't seem... any use.  This used to be the main highway.  Want to register, please?

turns.speaker: ARBOGAST
turns.text: Sit down. I don't want to trouble you, just want to ask...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: No trouble. Today's linen day. I change all the beds once a week, whether they've been used or not... dampness. I hate the smell of dampness.  It's such a dank smell.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You out to buy a motel?

turns.speaker: ARBOGAST
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Oh. I thought... you said you'd been to so many in two days...  What was it you wanted to ask?

turns.speaker: ARBOGAST
turns.text: I'm looking for a missing person.  My name's Arbogast, private investigator...  Trying to trace a young girl who's been missing almost a week. From Phoenix.  It's a private matter... family wants to forgive her...  She isn't in trouble.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I didn't think the police went searching for people who weren't in trouble.

turns.speaker: ARBOGAST
turns.text: I'm not the police.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: ARBOGAST
turns.text: We have reason to believe she came this way... might have stopped in this area...  Did she stop here?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: No. No one has stopped here in weeks...

turns.speaker: ARBOGAST
turns.text: Mind looking at the picture before committing yourself?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Committing myself to what? You sure talk like a Policeman.

turns.speaker: ARBOGAST
turns.text: Look at the picture. Please.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: No. At least I don't recall.

turns.speaker: ARBOGAST
turns.text: She might have used an alias. Mary Crane's the real name, but she might've registered...

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I don't even bother with guests registering any more... I mean, little by little, you drop the formalities.  I shouldn't even bother to change the linen. I guess habits die hard. Which reminds me...

turns.speaker: ARBOGAST
turns.text: Now there's a couple even remarking about your sign, and see how easily you forgot them?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ARBOGAST
turns.text: You thought no one has stopped here in weeks. Now, try to remember if this girl...

turns.speaker: ARBOGAST
turns.text: Don't know where she got "Marie," but "Samuels" figures. Her boy friend's name is Sam.  Was she in disguise? Or do you want to check the picture again?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I didn't lie to you. I just have trouble keeping track of... time.
